com.nokia.maps.component.touch.button

Class AbstractButtonComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nokia.maps.component.AbstractMapComponent
      • com.nokia.maps.component.touch.TouchComponent
        • com.nokia.maps.component.touch.VisibleTouchComponent
          • com.nokia.maps.component.touch.button.AbstractButtonComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MapComponent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageButton, TextButton

    public abstract class AbstractButtonComponent
extends VisibleTouchComponent
    This class offers an abstract base class for all MapComponents which wish to display a button on a MapDisplay. The class handles button presses and on screen positioning of the button.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractButtonComponent

        public AbstractButtonComponent(java.lang.String id,
                       int anchor,
                       Renderer renderer)
        This method instantiates the basis of a button MapComponent. Subclasses should call this method when they are created.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique id for this button MapComponent
        anchor - Which corner the button is attached to.
        renderer - the class responsible for rendering this button.

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        public void attach(MapDisplay map)
        This method is called whenever the component is attached to a MapDisplay, it calculates the position to draw the button on screen.
        Specified by:
        attach in interface MapComponent
        Overrides:
        attach in class AbstractMapComponent
        Parameters:
        map - the MapDisplay the component is attached to.

      • positionUIOnScreen

        protected final void positionUIOnScreen()
        This method calculates the position of the component based on the current map.

      • setOffset

        public final void setOffset(int x,
             int y)
        This method sets how many pixels away from the corner a button is displayed.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis offset in pixels.
        y - y axis offset in pixels

      • toggleButton

        public abstract void toggleButton()
        This method switches the button on or off. Subclases should implement this method to run code specific the custom MapComponent

      • touchAt

        protected void touchAt(Point point)
        This method touches the button. Subclasses should implement toggleButton() to run any code associated with them. The button highlight is subsequently reset.
        Overrides:
        touchAt in class VisibleTouchComponent
        Parameters:
        point - the position touched on screen
